result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:06 PM
Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael P Polzin in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Michael P Polzin. KMS Clerk.

Includes 20CF266, 20CF407, 20CF411, 20CF422, 20CM236, 21CF94, 21CF99,22CF26, 20FO424, 20TR2390, 20TR2392, 21FO205, 21TR1112, 21TR1113, 21TR1114, 21TR1115

Off the Record 3:08 p.m.

On the record 3:10 p.m.

Court address that the case proposed for jury trial is 22CF26

Attorney Rivard addresses to the Court that Mr. Polzin wishes to have a different attorney represent, there are new charges against him, and that he withdraw as attorney for the defendant 

ADA Maki confirms that a new case has just been filed 

Attorney Rivard explains to the Court that Mr. Polzin would like to have an attorney represent him where they do not regularly practice law in Dunn or St. Croix counties

ADA Maki-indicates to the court that he believes that Mr. Polzin may only be allowed 2 different Public Defenders 

Attorney Rivard does believe that the Public Defender's Office would appoint another attorney for Mr. Polzin

Court-is not inclined to approve Attorney Rivard's request to withdraw as counsel until there is confirmation from the Public Defender's office that they can appoint an attorney outside of Dunn and St. Croix counties to represent him. 

Court does believe there is a need for a mandatory withdrawal of Attorney Rivard at this time

Attorney Rivard needs to reach out the Public Defender's office to see if they will appoint counsel for Mr. Polzin and communicate that to the court

Court reviews witness list with ADA Maki, he believes that 1 day is sufficient for the trial
Attorney Rivard has not disclosed any witnesses to the court--the Court will authorize that defense has until April 29, 2022 to file a witness list 
Attorney Rivard objects to the State's Motion in Limine and the State's 2nd Motion in Limine

Court orders that Attorney Rivard file a written response/objections with legal arguments to the Court by the end of business on May 4, 2022. The State must file any reply by May 11, 2022. 

Court asks that a list of jury instructions and any exhibit lists be filed with the Court by May 4, 2022

Court would like to have another final pre-trial conference to go over the motions with the parties. Parties are to appear in-person at the Final Pre-Trial Conference.

Judge amends the bond on 22CF26: No contact with the St. Croix County Clerk of Courts office or the Judicial Assistants for the Circuit Court by telephone or personal contact. Filings in writing are allowed.

Mr. Polzin makes a statement to the Court 

Court address Mr. Polzin that case 22CF26 will proceed forward with the speedy jury trial

Mr. Polzin has concerns about getting a fair trial. 

The court advises him that he can file motions/objections with the court in writing thru his attorney.
Final pre-trial scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
